bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, April 11, 1923

div1.p: Russell forwards White's comments on possible yellow fever in Muzo in 1907.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, April 11, 1923
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Columbia
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
-----
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. RIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR G. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
April 11, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your letter of
April tenth. It came this morning just in time for
Doctor White to see it before he sailed. Doctor
White's comment was that if there has been yellow
fever in the region about Muzo, it occurred earlier
than the investigations you mention - in 1907 or
thereabouts.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F. F. Russell Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FRR:EP
